entries.meaning: A portion of a contracted project that is contracted out in turn.
examples: Once the prime contract has been awarded, “major” subcontractors typically remain the same over the life cycle of the program—from development to production—even if the subcontracts were originally competed.

verbs.description: subcontract (third-person singular simple present subcontracts, present participle subcontracting, simple past and past participle subcontracted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To contract out portions of a larger contracted project.
